info.title: Bills
info.description: Enables you to retrieve bills, influence their life cycle, and manage the interaction with follow-on processes such as credit card payment settlement and invoicing.

servers.description: 'Bills v2' REST API for SAP Subscription Billing

tags.name: Bill Transfer
tags.description: Retrieve transferable bills and manage successor documents.

tags.name: Event Log
tags.description: Retrieve the event log for bills.

get.description:
Bills without effective charges (or credits) are automatically excluded from the response. These are bills that only contain charges (or credits) that have been balanced out as a result of changes in the subscription or the rate plan. Examples of such changes are subscription withdrawal, subscription cancellation, and price changes.
Charges (or credits) with a monetary value of zero are included in the response. For example, usage-based charges for which no usage was reported yet.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
The first billing date for which you want to retrieve bills.
The date must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD .

parameters.name: to
parameters.description:
The day **after** the last billing date for which you want to retrieve bills. For example, you can retrieve bills with a billing date within a particular month by entering the first of the following month for the `to` parameter.
The date must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD .

parameters.name: splitElement
parameters.description: The bill split element for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: contractAccount
parameters.description: The contract account in SAP S/4HANA that is used to define payment methods, the dunning procedure, and tolerances, for example. The contract account is derived from the subscription if specified there.

parameters.name: billingType
parameters.description: The billing type for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: market.id
parameters.description: The identifier of the market for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: customer.id
parameters.description: The identifier of the customer for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: billItems.subscription.id
parameters.description: The identifier of the subscription for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: billItems.subscription.documentNumber
parameters.description: The document number of the subscription for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: billItems.subscription.subscriptionDocumentId
parameters.description: The document identifier of the subscription for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: billItems.product.id
parameters.description: The identifier of the product for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: billItems.ratePlan.id
parameters.description: The identifier of the rate plan for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: bill.customReferences.<typeCode>
parameters.description:
The type code and ID of a custom reference on the bill header for which you want to retrieve bills. The type code defines the reference type in Business Configuration. The ID is the value of the custom reference.
Add the string at end of request in the format `?bill.customReferences.=` for example: `?bill.customReferences.driverLicenseNumber=468962439`
You can select multiple references, for example: `?bill.customReferences.driverLicenseNumber=468962439&bill.customReferences.SSN=23917228334003`

parameters.name: billItems.customReferences.<typeCode>
parameters.description:
The type code and ID of a custom reference on any bill item for which you want to retrieve bills. The type code defines the reference type in Business Configuration. The ID is the value of the custom reference.
Add the string at end of request in the format `?billItems.customReferences.=` for example: `?billItems.customReferences.PO=4711`
You can select multiple references, for example: `?billItems.customReferences.PO=4711&billItems.customReferences.PC=47`

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Include certain additional properties within the bill by providing a comma-separated list of supported keywords. Properties are included automatically in the response when a filter query is applied to them.
Please be aware that SAP may later include further properties in the default, non-expanded response. Therefore you should not rely on certain properties being absent from the response when you do not use the `expand` query parameter.
Note that if you specify `subCharges` also `subCredits` are provided and vice versa.

parameters.name: billStatus
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of bill statuses for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: transferStatus
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of transfer statuses for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: paymentStatus
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of payment statuses for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: closing.latestAttempt.successful
parameters.description: Indicates whether you want to retrieve bills for which the latest closing attempt was successful. Set `false` if you want to retrieve bills for which the latest closing attempt failed.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description:
The page number to be retrieved, where the size of the pages must be specified by the `pageSize` parameter.
The number of the first page is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of bills retrieved on each page. The page size must be greater or equal to 1. Maximum page size is 100.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Parameter that influences the sorting of returned bills by a property on bill header level. Required format is `sort=property,(asc|desc)`. Nested sorting is also supported by providing the sort parameter multiple times in the required order.
Example: `?sort=market.id,desc&sort=billingDate,asc`
If no value is specified, the returned bills are sorted by `billingDate`, descending, and then by `documentNumber`, descending.
The following properties are not supported: * market.priceType * creditCard * netAmount * grossAmount * taxAmount * billStatus * transferStatus
Note: When using the API Hub tryout functionality, it is currently not possible to sort by more than one criterion.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description:
If `false`, the response headers `x-count` and `x-pagecount` will not be returned. The recommended setting is `false` if not otherwise required by a special use case, as this results in a significantly faster response time.

 Note that when using the more recent `$filter` syntax, this parameter defaults to `false`. Only when the request contains exclusively legacy request parameters, `true` is used as default, for compatibility with existing API consumers.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
Filter bills using the `$filter` syntax of the OData protocol. Compared to the previously released query functionality of the Bills API, this offers the advantage of a standardized query syntax. OData is also used by many other SAP products.

Important: Only the query syntax supports the OData standard. Responses do not follow the OData standard and are unchanged compared to a query using the legacy syntax, to keep them compatible for existing API consumers.

The functionality is currently limited to the following:

1. Filtering for property `createdAt` using the ISO 8601 compatible timestamp format `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSSZ` in UTC timezone or with UTC offset `YYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SS±hh:mm`.

2. Using the following comparison operators: 
 - `gt` (greater than) 
 - `ge` (greater than or equal to) 
 - `lt` (lower than) 
 - `le` (lower than or equal to) 
3. Multiple filter expressions in a single query are supported using the `and` and `or` operators.

Any other functionality is not supported and will return a `501` `Not Implemented` error, for example. 

 When using `$filter`, the `$count` functionality defaults to `false`. Explicitly set query parameter `$count` to `true` in case it is required. The recommended setting in combination with `$filter` is the default (`false`), if not otherwise required by a special use case, as this results in a significantly faster response time.

createdAfter.summary: Bills created after a particular date.

createdAtOrAfter.summary: Bills created on or after a particular date.

createdBefore.summary: Bills created before a particular date.

createdAtOrBefore.summary: Bills created on or before a particular date.

createdBetweenAPeriod.summary: Bills created in a particular year.

createdAfterOrBefore.summary: Bills created before or after a particular date.

createdAfterWithNegativeOffset.summary: Bills created after a particular date with an offset of 2 hours and 30 minutes in a time zone west of UTC±00:00.

createdAfterWithPositiveOffset.summary: Bills created after a particular date with an offset of 2 hours and 30 minutes in a time zone east of UTC±00:00.

x-pagecount.description: The total number of pages. Can be influenced by the `pageSize` parameter. A larger pageSize returns fewer pages and vice versa.

x-count.description: The total number of bills matching the query.

result.message: Bill could not be closed due to pricing errors. Check the Bills app for more details. Affected subscriptions: 8

400.description: Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again. You can also check the response payload for more information.

401.description: There is a problem with your token. Generate a new token as described in the API Guide.

500.description: There was an error on the server side. If the problem persists, please report the error as described by SAP.

501.description: You are trying to execute an unsupported operation. You can also check the response payload for more information.

example.message: The OData filter expression contains an operator that is not currently supported in this API.

post.description:
Submits a mass closing request that will be processed asynchronously. You can fetch the processing result with the GET endpoint.
Once closed, a bill cannot be reopened. Any usage data that is relevant for the bill and received after the bill is closed does **not** update the closed bill. Neither is an additional bill created for this usage. This is the case even if usage records are created successfully.

202.description: The mass closing request has been accepted. It will be processed asynchronously. The `location` header points to a mass closing request that is available as soon as the request is completed.

location.description: Link to the mass closing request.

400.description: Either your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format, or a request with the same filter is already running.

get.description: Retrieves all mass closing requests of the last 90 days. Note that requests are only kept for 90 days after the mass closing request was completed.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description:
The page number to be retrieved, where the size of the pages must be specified by the `pageSize` parameter.
The number of the first page is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of processed bills retrieved on each page. The page size must be greater or equal to 1. Maximum page size is 100. If not specified a default page size of 40 is applied

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: If `false`, the response headers `x-count` and `x-pagecount` will not be returned. The recommended setting is `false` if not otherwise required by a special use case, as this results in a significantly faster response time.

get.description: Retrieves a single mass closing request with a specific identifier. Note that requests are only kept for 90 days after the mass closing request was completed.

parameters.name: massClosingRequestId
parameters.description: The mass closing request ID

result.message: The bill has already been closed.
The bill has already been closed.

202.description: The asynchronous request is still being processed. You can find the progress below. Please try again later.

400.description: Either your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format, or a request with the same filter is already running.

get.summary: Retrieves bills processed by a mass closing request.
get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of bills processed by a mass closing request. This enables you to retrieve all processed bills if more than 40 bills are included in the mass closing request.

parameters.name: massClosingRequestId
parameters.description: The identifier of the mass closing request.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description:
The page number to be retrieved, where the size of the pages must be specified by the `pageSize` parameter.
The number of the first page is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of processed bills retrieved on each page. The page size must be greater or equal to 1. Maximum page size is 100. If not specified a default page size of 40 is applied

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: If `false`, the response headers `link`, `x-count` and `x-pagecount` will not be returned. The recommended setting is `false` if not otherwise required by a special use case, as this results in a significantly faster response time.

preference-applied.description: Preferences that were applied by the system in case optional parameters were not supplied.

link.description: RFC 5988 compliant links to the previous and next pages, if available.

x-pagecount.description: The total number of pages. Can be influenced by the `pageSize` parameter. A larger pageSize returns fewer pages and vice versa.

x-count.description: The total number of processed bills.

result.message: The bill has already been closed.

202.description: The asynchronous request is still being processed. You can find the progress below. Please try again later.

400.description: Either your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format, or a request with the same filter is already running.

get.description:
Optional information, for example credit card data, can be added using dedicated keywords.
If the requested bill has no effective charges (or credits), it is automatically excluded from the response. A bill can have no effective charges (or credits) if it only contains charges (or credits) that have been balanced out as a result of changes in the subscription or the rate plan. Examples of such changes are subscription withdrawal, subscription cancellation, and price changes.
Before you use this operation, check the [API Guide](https://help.sap.com/viewer/987aec876092428f88162e438acf80d6/latest/en-US/841f5b6a4cab45aeb5dccd9704177fd4.html) for important information.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The ID or document number of the bill.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Include certain additional properties within the bill by providing a comma-separated list of supported keywords. Properties are included in the response automatically when a filter query is applied to them.
Note that if you use the keyword `originalBillReference` on its own, you will get a 400 error if the original bill is still open. This is not the case if you use the keyword `all`.
Note that the value `tax` is obsolete.
Please be aware that SAP may later include further properties in the default, non-expanded response. Therefore you should not rely on certain properties being absent from the response when you do not use the `expand` query parameter.

parameters.name: excludeZeroAmounts
parameters.description: Exclude zero-amount charges or/and credits from the response by providing the keyword `charges`, `credits` or both. Bill items with only zero-amount charges/credits are also excluded. In case there are no bill items left, the response status is 204 and no response body is provided. If keyword `billItems` is provided, bill items with a total amount of zero are excluded from the response. If all items of the requested bill have zero total amounts, the response status is 204 and no response body is provided.

etag.description: Entity tag for validation purposes. Please be aware that SAP may later change the mechanism for generating the value of the tag. Therefore, you should not assume that the value has a particular semantic meaning.

result.message: Bill could not be closed due to pricing errors. Check the Bills app for more details. Affected subscriptions: 7

204.description: The bill with the specified identifier exists but effectively contains no charges. This can occur, for example, when a subscription is withdrawn and an already created bill is not required anymore. If subsequent actions (like creating a new subscription) lead to charges, the bill may become relevant again. Using query parameter `excludeZeroAmounts` can also lead to this response code being returned.

400.description: Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again. You can also check the response payload for more information.

401.description: There is a problem with your token. Generate a new token as described in the API Guide.

404.description: The specified bill does not exist.

example.message: No bill with the requested document number '1234' was found in the database.

409.description: Not all requested data is available.

502.description: Data could not be retrieved from another system. This can happen if you requested credit card data but this data could not be retrieved. If the problem persists, please report the error as described by SAP.

get.summary: Retrieves the complete event log of a bill.
get.description: Note that the event log is built up only from the day that it became available in your tenant (October 28/29, 2020). Therefore, the event log will not include any changes to the bill that took place before the delivery of the event log feature.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The ID or document number of the bill.

404.description: The specified bill does not exist.

application/json.message: No bill with the requested document number '1234' was found in the database.

500.description: There was an error on the server side. If the problem persists, please report the error as described by SAP.

post.description:
Once closed, a bill cannot be reopened. Any usage data that is relevant for the bill and received after the bill is closed does **not** update the closed bill. Neither is an additional bill created for this usage. This is the case even if usage records are created successfully.
Before you use this operation, check the [API Guide](https://help.sap.com/viewer/987aec876092428f88162e438acf80d6/latest/en-US/8b03a0ba5bea4abe9712f833c633f8d9.html) for important information.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The ID or document number of the bill.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description:
Use if you want to ensure that the current representation of the resource was unmodified compared to a previous read state. The value you use here is the entity tag (header field `etag`) from a previous GET request. If used, the service will check if the current representation of resource matches the entity tag. In case there is no match, status code 412 _Precondition failed_ will be returned.
If `if-match` is not used the system will apply the change on the most current state of the resource. This can fail on rare occasions when multiple changes are applied to the resource at the same time. In that case the system will return status code 409 _Conflict_.
On failure you should read the current state of the resource, check if your changes should still be applied and submit the request again.

400.description: Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again. You can also check the response payload for more information.

404.description: The specified bill does not exist.

example.message: No bill with the requested document number '1234' was found in the database.

409.description:
The bill cannot be closed for one of the following reasons: 
 - The bill is already closed or in the process of being closed. 
 - The bill was created or updated very recently and is awaiting processing. 
 - The bill was updated by the system or another user in the meantime.

value.message: Bill is in the process of being closed.
The bill could not be updated because it was updated by the system or another user in the meantime.
The bill could not be closed as it is awaiting processing. This can be the case for recently created or updated bills. Please try again later.

412.description: The bill could not be updated because it was updated by the system or another user in the meantime.

example.message: The bill could not be updated because it was updated by the system or another user in the meantime.

500.description: There was an error on the server side. If the problem persists, please report the error as described by SAP.

patch.description:
By default, bills are closed automatically when the billing date is reached. However, you can prevent automatic closing by specifying that a bill must be closed manually.
Before you use this operation, check the [API Guide](https://help.sap.com/viewer/987aec876092428f88162e438acf80d6/latest/en-US/27ddce7d0f18444eb673ca6328ff540d.html) for important information.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The ID or document number of the bill.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description:
Use if you want to ensure that the current representation of the resource was unmodified compared to a previous read state. The value you use here is the entity tag (header field `etag`) from a previous GET request. If used, the service will check if the current representation of resource matches the entity tag. In case there is no match, status code 412 _Precondition failed_ will be returned.
If `if-match` is not used the system will apply the change on the most current state of the resource. This can fail on rare occasions when multiple changes are applied to the resource at the same time. In that case the system will return status code 409 _Conflict_.
On failure you should read the current state of the resource, check if your changes should still be applied and submit the request again.

requestBody.description:
A set of modifications to the `closing` subresource.
Follows the JSON Merge Patch format as described in [RFC 7396](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7396).

post.summary: Retriggers settlement of credit card payments.
post.description:
Retriggers the settlement of credit card payment for a closed bill with the payment status `FAILED` or `ERROR`.
Before you use this operation, check the [API Guide](https://help.sap.com/viewer/987aec876092428f88162e438acf80d6/latest/en-US/cb53410361214d5a8546d33ad171e73e.html) for important information.
Note that you can only use this endpoint if you have integrated with SAP digital payments add-on and have chosen to trigger the settlement of credit card payments from SAP Subscription Billing.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The ID or document number of the bill.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description:
Use if you want to ensure that the current representation of the resource was unmodified compared to a previous read state. The value you use here is the entity tag (header field `etag`) from a previous GET request. If used, the service will check if the current representation of resource matches the entity tag. In case there is no match, status code 412 _Precondition failed_ will be returned.
If `if-match` is not used the system will apply the change on the most current state of the resource. This can fail on rare occasions when multiple changes are applied to the resource at the same time. In that case the system will return status code 409 _Conflict_.
On failure you should read the current state of the resource, check if your changes should still be applied and submit the request again.

200.description: Credit card payment settlement executed successfully.

post.summary: Indicates transfer of a bill to invoicing.
post.description:
You can use this endpoint to change the transfer status of a bill from `NOT_TRANSFERRED` to `TRANSFER_IN_PROGRESS`. Bills with the status `TRANSFER_IN_PROGRESS` will not be retrieved by the `/bills/transferable` (GET) endpoint.
Before you use this operation, check the [API Guide](https://help.sap.com/docs/CLOUD_TO_CASH_OD/987aec876092428f88162e438acf80d6/6c0713612f58481fb4c68bf3890dc7d5.html) for important information.
In SAP-defined integrations, the transfer status `TRANSFER_IN_PROGRESS` is set automatically when transfer begins. If you use a customer-defined integration, or if you set up integration before the status `TRANSFER_IN_PROGRESS` was added to the predefined integration content, you can use this endpoint to set the status and prevent duplicate transfers.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The ID or document number of the bill.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description:
Use if you want to ensure that the current representation of the resource was unmodified compared to a previous read state. The value you use here is the entity tag (header field `etag`) from a previous GET request. If used, the service will check if the current representation of resource matches the entity tag. In case there is no match, status code 412 _Precondition failed_ will be returned.
If `if-match` is not used the system will apply the change on the most current state of the resource. This can fail on rare occasions when multiple changes are applied to the resource at the same time. In that case the system will return status code 409 _Conflict_.
On failure you should read the current state of the resource, check if your changes should still be applied and submit the request again.

 - The bill has already been transferred. 
 - The bill is already being transferred. 
 - The bill is not yet ready to be transferred. 
 - The bill cannot be transferred as it is used for internal billing only.

post.summary: Manages successor documents of a bill.
post.description:
Successor documents are follow-up documents in other systems, for example, invoices in SAP S/4HANA.
For successor documents to be added, a bill must be closed and marked as relevant for the invoice creation.
Before you use this operation, check the [API Guide](https://help.sap.com/viewer/987aec876092428f88162e438acf80d6/latest/en-US/df3d444416664e6d8591ac6f6261d708.html) for important information.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The ID or document number of the bill.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description:
Use if you want to ensure that the current representation of the resource was unmodified compared to a previous read state. The value you use here is the entity tag (header field `etag`) from a previous GET request. If used, the service will check if the current representation of resource matches the entity tag. In case there is no match, status code 412 _Precondition failed_ will be returned. 
If `if-match` is not used the system will apply the change on the most current state of the resource. This can fail on rare occasions when multiple changes are applied to the resource at the same time. In that case the system will return status code 409 _Conflict_. 
On failure you should read the current state of the resource, check if your changes should still be applied and submit the request again.

400.description: Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again. You can also check the response payload for more information.

401.description: There is a problem with your token. Generate a new token as described in the API Guide.

404.description: The specified bill does not exist.

example.message: No bill with the requested document number '1234' was found in the database.

409.description:
Adding of successor documents to a bill is not allowed because the bill is either flagged as for internal billing or not yet closed.
The bill could not be updated because it was updated by the system or another user in the meantime.

412.description: The bill could not be updated because it was updated by the system or another user in the meantime.

example.message: The bill could not be updated because it was updated by the system or another user in the meantime.

500.description: There was an error on the server side. If the problem persists, please report the error as described by SAP.

delete.summary: Deletes all successor document references of a bill.
delete.description:
You can delete successor document references if at least one successor document was not created due to a failure during transfer of billing data to another system.
Before you use this operation, check the [API Guide](https://help.sap.com/viewer/987aec876092428f88162e438acf80d6/latest/en-US/df3d444416664e6d8591ac6f6261d708.html) for important information.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The ID or document number of the bill.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description:
Use if you want to ensure that the current representation of the resource was unmodified compared to a previous read state. The value you use here is the entity tag (header field `etag`) from a previous GET request. If used, the service will check if the current representation of resource matches the entity tag. In case there is no match, status code 412 _Precondition failed_ will be returned.
If `if-match` is not used the system will apply the change on the most current state of the resource. This can fail on rare occasions when multiple changes are applied to the resource at the same time. In that case the system will return status code 409 _Conflict_.
On failure you should read the current state of the resource, check if your changes should still be applied and submit the request again.

204.description: References to successor documents deleted successfully.

401.description: There is a problem with your token. Generate a new token as described in the API Guide.

404.description: The bill with the specified ID does not exist, or the successor document with the specified ID does not exist.

example.message: No bill with the requested document number '1234' was found in the database.

412.description: The bill could not be updated because it was updated by the system or another user in the meantime.

example.message: The bill could not be updated because it was updated by the system or another user in the meantime.

500.description: There was an error on the server side. If the problem persists, please report the error as described by SAP.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of failed transfer attempts.
get.description: Retrieves a list of failed transfer attempts for a specific bill.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The ID or document number of the bill.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description:
The page number to be retrieved, where the size of the pages must be specified by the `pageSize` parameter.
The number of the first page is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of bills retrieved on each page. The page size must be greater or equal to 1. Maximum page size is 100.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: If `false`, the response headers `x-count` and `x-pagecount` will not be returned. The recommended setting is `false` if not otherwise required by a special use case, as this results in a significantly faster response time.

x-pagecount.description: The total number of pages. Can be influenced by the `pageSize` parameter. A larger pageSize returns fewer pages and vice versa.

x-count.description: The total number of successor documents matching the query.

400.description: Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again. You can also check the response payload for more information.

401.description: There is a problem with your token. Generate a new token as described in the API Guide.

404.description: The specified bill does not exist.

example.message: No bill with the requested document number '1234' was found in the database.

500.description: There was an error on the server side. If the problem persists, please report the error as described by SAP.

post.summary: Manages failed transfer attempts of a bill.
post.description:
You can report failed attempts to transfer billing data and create successor documents in other systems.
Before you use this operation, check the [API Guide](https://help.sap.com/viewer/987aec876092428f88162e438acf80d6/latest/en-US/df3d444416664e6d8591ac6f6261d708.html) for important information.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The ID or document number of the bill.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description:
Use if you want to ensure that the current representation of the resource was unmodified compared to a previous read state. The value you use here is the entity tag (header field `etag`) from a previous GET request. If used, the service will check if the current representation of resource matches the entity tag. In case there is no match, status code 412 _Precondition failed_ will be returned.
If `if-match` is not used the system will apply the change on the most current state of the resource. This can fail on rare occasions when multiple changes are applied to the resource at the same time. In that case the system will return status code 409 _Conflict_.
On failure you should read the current state of the resource, check if your changes should still be applied and submit the request again.

400.description: Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again. You can also check the response payload for more information.

401.description: There is a problem with your token. Generate a new token as described in the API Guide.

404.description: The specified bill does not exist.

example.message: No bill with the requested document number '1234' was found in the database.

409.description:
Adding of failed transfer attempt to a bill is not allowed because the bill is either flagged as for internal billing or not yet closed.
The bill could not be updated because it was updated by the system or another user in the meantime.

412.description: The bill could not be updated because it was updated by the system or another user in the meantime.

example.message: The bill could not be updated because it was updated by the system or another user in the meantime.

500.description: There was an error on the server side. If the problem persists, please report the error as described by SAP.

delete.summary: Deletes all failed transfer attempts of a bill.
delete.description:
Failed transfer attempts can be reported during the transfer of billing data to other systems. The transfer fails if a successor document cannot be created. You can delete the failed attempts, for example in order to enable a retry of the transfer.
Before you use this operation, check the [API Guide](https://help.sap.com/viewer/987aec876092428f88162e438acf80d6/latest/en-US/df3d444416664e6d8591ac6f6261d708.html) for important information.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The ID or document number of the bill.

parameters.name: if-match
parameters.description:
Use if you want to ensure that the current representation of the resource was unmodified compared to a previous read state. The value you use here is the entity tag (header field `etag`) from a previous GET request. If used, the service will check if the current representation of resource matches the entity tag. In case there is no match, status code 412 _Precondition failed_ will be returned.
If `if-match` is not used the system will apply the change on the most current state of the resource. This can fail on rare occasions when multiple changes are applied to the resource at the same time. In that case the system will return status code 409 _Conflict_.
On failure you should read the current state of the resource, check if your changes should still be applied and submit the request again.

204.description: All failed transfer attempts deleted successfully.

401.description: There is a problem with your token. Generate a new token as described in the API Guide.

404.description: The bill with the specified ID does not exist.

example.message: No bill with the requested document number '1234' was found in the database.

412.description: The bill could not be updated because it was updated by the system or another user in the meantime.

example.message: The bill could not be updated because it was updated by the system or another user in the meantime.

500.description: There was an error on the server side. If the problem persists, please report the error as described by SAP.

get.description:
Retrieve the invoice PDF document that is stored in a successor document system.
Before you use this operation, check the [API Guide](https://help.sap.com/viewer/987aec876092428f88162e438acf80d6/latest/en-US/197824c110e24b08a0db3f8944251a0f.html) for important information.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The ID or document number of the bill.

parameters.name: documentSystem
parameters.description: The successor document system to which the bill was transferred.

parameters.name: documentIdentifier
parameters.description: The invoice ID for the bill in the successor document system.

401.description: There is a problem with your token. Generate a new token as described in the API Guide.

404.description: The bill with the specified ID does not exist, or the successor document with the specified successor document system and successor document ID does not exist.

example.message: No bill with the requested document number '1234' was found in the database.

500.description: There was an error on the server side. If the problem persists, please report the error as described by SAP.

501.description: The successor document system is not configured in your destination configuration.

502.description: The successor document system is not reachable.

get.description:
Retrieve the identifiers of bills that are ready for transfer to external systems for further processing, such as invoicing. Bills are ready for transfer if they are closed (`billStatus` is `CLOSED`), they have not yet been transferred (`transferStatus` is `NOT_TRANSFERRED`) and they do not yet have a successor document or failed transfer attempt assigned.
Bills for subscriptions of the type *Internal Billing* are not retrieved. If you want to prevent certain bills from being transferred (for example, for testing purposes), you can set this subscription type in the product or subscription.
Bills without effective charges (or credits) are automatically excluded from the response. These are bills that contain only charges (or credits) that have been balanced out as a result of changes in the subscription or the rate plan. Examples of such changes are subscription withdrawal, subscription cancellation, and price changes.
Note: The criteria that make a bill transferable may in future also relate to other properties of a bill due to functional developments. Therefore you should not assume that a query of the `/bills` resource with the above query parameters will return the same bills as `/bills/transferable` in the future.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
The first billing date for which you want to retrieve bills.
The date must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD .

parameters.name: to
parameters.description:
The day **after** the last billing date for which you want to retrieve bills. For example, you can retrieve bills with a billing date within a particular month by entering the first of the following month for the `to` parameter.
The date must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD .

parameters.name: splitElement
parameters.description: The bill split element for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: billingType
parameters.description: The billing type for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: market.id
parameters.description: The identifier of the market for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: customer.id
parameters.description: The identifier of the customer for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: billItems.subscription.id
parameters.description: The identifier of the subscription for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: billItems.subscription.documentNumber
parameters.description: The document number of the subscription for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: billItems.product.id
parameters.description: The identifier of the product for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: billItems.ratePlan.id
parameters.description: The identifier of the rate plan for which you want to retrieve bills.

parameters.name: billItems.customReferences.<typeCode>
parameters.description:
The type code and ID of a custom reference for which you want to retrieve bills. The type code defines the reference type in Business Configuration. The ID is the value of the custom reference.
Add the string at end of request in the format `?billItems.customReferences.=` for example: `?billItems.customReferences.PO=4711`
You can select multiple references, for example: `?billItems.customReferences.PO=4711&billItems.customReferences.PC=47`

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description:
The page number to be retrieved, where the size of the pages must be specified by the `pageSize` parameter.
The number of the first page is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of bills retrieved on each page. The page size must be greater or equal to 1. Maximum page size is 100.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: If `false`, the response headers `x-count` and `x-pagecount` will not be returned. The recommended setting is `false` if not otherwise required by a special use case, as this results in a significantly faster response time.

x-pagecount.description: The total number of pages. Can be influenced by the `pageSize` parameter. A larger pageSize returns fewer pages and vice versa.

x-count.description: The total number of transferable bills matching the query.

400.description: Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again. You can also check the response payload for more information.

401.description: There is a problem with your token. Generate a new token as described in the API Guide.

500.description: There was an error on the server side. If the problem persists, please report the error as described by SAP.

delete.description:
You can delete bill items that are marked for deletion from closed bills. Items of closed bills are marked for deletion when the respective subscription is deleted.
Caution: You should only delete subscriptions and their associated bills before productive use of SAP Subscription Billing. The deletion is not reversible and SAP cannot restore deleted data.
Before you use this operation, check the [API Guide](https://help.sap.com/viewer/987aec876092428f88162e438acf80d6/latest/en-US/e1843e7189bd40c3b7eea08748bbb584.html) for important information.

parameters.name: simulation
parameters.description: If `true` the bill items in scope of this request will not be deleted, but just listed in the response.

parameters.name: billItems.subscription.id
parameters.description: The ID of the subscription for which you want to delete bill items.

parameters.name: billItems.subscription.item.id
parameters.description: The ID of the subscription item for which you want to delete bill items.

parameters.name: bill.id
parameters.description: The ID of the bill containing items that you want to delete.

parameters.name: bill.documentNumber
parameters.description: The document number of the bill containing items that you want to delete

parameters.name: bill.billingDate.from
parameters.description:
The billing date starting from which you want to delete bill items.
The date must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: bill.billingDate.to
parameters.description: The day **after** the last billing date for which you want to delete bill items. The date must be in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

202.description: The bill item deletion request has been accepted. It will be processed asynchronously. The `Location` header points to a deletion log that is available as soon as the request is completed.

400.description: The request was rejected because of invalid parameters, or a request with the same parameters is already running.

get.description: Retrieves all deletion logs of the last 90 days. Deletion logs provide information about deletion requests. Note that logs are only kept for 90 days after the deletion request was completed.

Retrieves a single deletion log with a specific identifier. Deletion logs provide information about deletion requests. Note that logs are only kept for 90 days after the deletion request was completed.

parameters.name: deletionLogId
parameters.description: The deletion log ID

202.description: The asynchronous request is still being processed. Please try again later.

get.summary: Retrieves the deleted bill items from a deletion log.
get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of deleted bill items from a deletion log. This enables you to retrieve all deleted items if more than 40 items are included in the deletion log.

parameters.name: deletionLogId
parameters.description: The deletion log ID

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description:
The page number to be retrieved, where the size of the pages must be specified by the `pageSize` parameter.
The number of the first page is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of deleted items retrieved on each page. The page size must be greater or equal to 1. Maximum page size is 100. If not specified a default page size of 40 is applied

preference-applied.description: Preferences that were applied by the system in case optional parameters were not supplied.

link.description: RFC 5988 compliant links to the previous and next pages, if available.

x-pagecount.description: The total number of pages. Can be influenced by the `pageSize` parameter. A larger pageSize returns fewer pages and vice versa.

x-count.description: The total number of deleted items.

202.description: The asynchronous request is still being processed. Please try again later.

400.description: Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again. You can also check the response payload for more information.

get.summary: Retrieves the usage records for a charge.
get.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of usage records that are relevant for a charge.
Note: This API can only be used in combination with the GET /bills/{id} API.
There you will find in the response body the fully specified path for GET /bills/{identifier}/billItems/{itemId}/charges/{chargeId}/usageRecords under the following conditions:
1.The expand parameter usageRecords is used.
2.The value of usageRecords of a specific charge is more than 100.
Only in this case, you will get the fully specified path for this API in the response body.
For example: usageRecords@nextLink:bills/A7E98BC8-329B-4742-B0AF-BF2034EB0908/billItems/D1277873-01D3-4AE3-A521-E008CEA1EDC4/charges/27A9756C-213E-4116-8B13-BFD62B1F41F4/usageRecords?pageNumber=2&pageSize=100.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The ID or document number of the bill.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the bill item.

parameters.name: chargeId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the credit.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description:
The page number to be retrieved, where the size of the pages must be specified by the `pageSize` parameter.
The number of the first page is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of usage records retrieved on each page. The page size must be greater or equal to 1. Maximum page size is 100. If not specified a default page size of 100 is applied.

link.description: RFC 5988 compliant links to the previous and next pages, if available.

400.description: Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again. You can also check the response payload for more information.

404.description: The specified charge does not exist.

get.summary: Retrieves the usage records for a credit.
get.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of usage records that are relevant for a credit.
Note: This API can only be used in combination with the GET /bills/{id} API.
There you will find in the response body the fully specified path for GET /bills/{identifier}/billItems/{itemId}/credits/{creditId}/usageRecords under the following conditions:
1.The expand parameter usageRecords is used.
2.The value of usageRecords of a specific credit is more than 100.
Only in this case, you will get the fully specified path for this API in the response body.
For example: usageRecords@nextLink:bills/A7E98BC8-329B-4742-B0AF-BF2034EB0908/billItems/D1277873-01D3-4AE3-A521-E008CEA1EDC4/credits/27A9756C-213E-4116-8B13-BFD62B1F41F4/usageRecords?pageNumber=2&pageSize=100.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The ID or document number of the bill.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the bill item.

parameters.name: creditId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the credit.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description:
The page number to be retrieved, where the size of the pages must be specified by the `pageSize` parameter.
The number of the first page is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of usage records retrieved on each page. The page size must be greater or equal to 1. Maximum page size is 100. If not specified a default page size of 100 is applied.

link.description: RFC 5988 compliant links to the previous and next pages, if available.

400.description: Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again. You can also check the response payload for more information.

404.description: The specified credit does not exist.

id.description: The unique identifier of the bill.

documentNumber.description: The document number of the bill. The document number is unique per tenant.

billingType.description:
Defines whether the bill contains charges or credits. Charges and credits are never on the same bill. 
However, future changes to the API may introduce this possibility and indicate it via this property.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the subscription, as named in the IANA Time Zone Database. If it wasn't provided when creating the subscription, the time zone is set to the time zone of the market. This field overrides the time zone of the market if the values differ.

dueDate.description: The date on which all charges or credits that will be included in the bill become due. On the due date the billing delay starts.

billingDate.description: The legal date of the bill, considering the time zone of the market.

billingProfileId.description: The identifier of the billing profile that was applied when the bill was created.

billStatus.description: Status that indicates whether the bill is open for changes. The bill is open until the billing date is reached. The status `CLOSING` is an intermediate state indicating that final processing steps are taking place to close the bill. This should not take more than a few minutes.

transferStatus.description:
Status that indicates whether the bill was transferred to a successor system.
`TRANSFERRED` shows that at least one successor document is assigned. Successor documents can be assigned and viewed using the `/bills/{identifier}/successorDocuments` resource.
`FAILED_PARTIALLY` shows that at least one successor document was created and at least one transfer attempt failed.
`FAILED` shows that no successor documents were created.

splitElement.description: An attribute that causes a separate bill to be created for a subscription. For example, if you provide the purchase order number as the bill split element, subscriptions for different purchase orders will be billed separately.

contractAccount.description: The contract account in SAP S/4HANA that is used to define payment methods, the dunning procedure, and tolerances, for example. The contract account is derived from the subscription if specified there.

createInvoice.description: Indicator that determines if an invoice will be created for the bill.

payer.description: The party that pays for the subscription.

billTo.description: The party that receives the invoice for the subscription. The bill-to party can be, but is not necessarily, the payer of the invoice.

creditCard.description: Not included in the response by default. Use query parameter `expand` with value `creditCard` to include this structure in the response.

customReferences.description: Custom references inherited from the customer. Not included in the response by default. Use query parameter `expand` with value `customReferences` to include this array in the response.

containsDeletableBillItems.description: If `true` the bill has items that are marked for deletion.

billItems.description: A bill contains a maximum of 100 items. If there are more than 100 items, a new bill is created, which in turn contains up to 100 items.

eventLog.description: Note that the event log is built up only from the day that it became available in your tenant (October 28/29, 2020). Therefore, the event log will not include any changes to the bill that took place before the delivery of the event log feature.

method.title: Method of closing
method.description:
`AUTO` if the bill will be closed on the predetermined billing date.
`MANUAL` if the bill will stay open until closed manually.

createdAt.description: The point in time when the bill was created.

billIds.title: Bill IDs
billIds.description: An array of bill IDs that can be transferred to a backend system.

token.description: The unique identifier of the card token.

type.description: The type text of the card.

typeText.description: The type text of the card.

expirationMonth.description: The expiration month of the card.

expirationYear.description: The expiration year of the card.

maskedCardNumber.description: The masked number of the card.

typeCode.description: The code representing the type of the reference.

status.description: original HTTP error code, should be consistent with the response HTTP code

type.description: classification of the error type, lower case with underscore eg validation_failure

details.description: list of problems causing this error

field.description: a bean notation expression specifying the element in request data causing the error, eg product.variants[3].name, this can be empty if violation was not field specific

type.description: classification of the error detail type, lower case with underscore eg missing_value, this value must be always interpreted in context of the general error type.

message.description: descriptive error detail message for debugging

status.description: original HTTP code, should be consistent with the response HTTP code

billItemDeletionLog.title: Bill Item Deletion Log
billItemDeletionLog.description: A set of deleted bill items or bill items found for deletion.

simulation.description: If `true`, the respective bill items are not deleted but are listed as a preview of items that potentially would be deleted with the given selection criteria.

uri.description: URI containing all parameters of the request.

deletedItems@nextLink.description: A link to the next page of deleted items, if more than 40 deleted items are present

deletedItems.description: A list of the bill items that were deleted with this request. Contains the first 40 deleted items only. If more than 40 items are present, you can retrieve the items with the endpoint `/deletableBillItems/deletionLogs/{deletionLogId}/deletedItems`.

name.description: The descriptive name of the allowance.

source.description: The type of included quantity. This can be an allowance or an included quantity defined in the rate plan.

allocatedQuantity.description: The usage quantity that is allocated to either an allowance or to an included quantity defined in the rate plan.

subscriptionDocumentId.description: The document identifier of the subscription. The document ID consists of a prefix, if configured in the subscription profile, and of a subscription number

externalObjectReference.title: External Object Reference
externalObjectReference.description: External object references store document references related to the subscription. External references are used for internal SAP integration scenarios.

externalSystemId.description: The identifier of an external system from which the object is replicated.

externalId.description: The document identifier from the external system.

externalIdTypeCode.description: The type of external object replicated from an external system.

usageRecord.title: Usage Record
usageRecord.description: The schema of a usage record.

id.description: The unique identifier of this usage record. The service generates the identifier, which is ignored if it is provided during the creation of the usage record.

startedAt.description: The start date (inclusive) of the aggregation period for the quantity of usage. This date is expressed in the UTC time zone with the following pattern: yyyy-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ.

endedAt.description: The end date (exclusive) of the aggregation period for the quantity of usage. This date is expressed in the UTC time zone with the following pattern: yyyy-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ.

metricId.description: The type of the technical resource.

subMetricId.description: The unique identifier of the rate subelement.

quantity.description: The number of units of usage, that is expressed by 0 or a positive number with up to 3 decimals.

usageRatingVariant.description: The rating variant of the usage record.

userTechnicalId.description: The identifier of the technical resource.

createdAt.description: The creation date of the usage record. This date is expressed in the UTC time zone with the following pattern: yyyy-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ.

subscriptionNumber.description: The number of the subscription this usage record was applied to.

subscriptionDocumentId.description: The document identifier of the subscription. The document ID consists of a prefix, if configured in the subscription profile, and of a subscription number.

paymentStatus.description: The overall payment status for all credit card settlements of the bill.

lineNumber.description: The line number of the credit. A credit line number is unique per bill item. This property is only available for closed bills.

ratingType.description: The rating type of the credit.

creditedQuantity.description: The usage quantity to be credited. This is usage that is not allocated to either an allowance or an included quantity defined in the rate plan.

includedQuantity.description: The quantity that is allocated either to an allowance or to an included quantity defined in the rate plan. This is determined by the `source` property (either `ALLOWANCE` or `RATE_PLAN_INCLUDED`).

reversal.description: Indicator that determines whether this credit reverses a previous credit.

usageRecords@nextLink.description: A link allows you to retrieve all usage records if more than 100 records are included in this credit.

usageRecords@count.description: The total number of usage records belonging to this credit. Note that it is displayed only when there are more than 100 usage records included in this credit.

lineNumber.description: The line number of the charge. A charge line number is unique per bill item. This property is only available for closed bills.

measurementSpecification.description: The custom JSON for the measurement specification.

subMetricId.description: The unique identifier of the rate subelement.

ratingType.description: The rating type of the charge.

externalObjectReferences.description: External object references inherited from specific subscription item attributes.

consumedQuantity.description: The usage for the rating period, as a quantity of units.

chargedQuantity.description: The usage quantity to be charged. This is usage that is not allocated to either an allowance or an included quantity defined in the rate plan.

includedQuantity.description: The quantity that is allocated either to an allowance or to an included quantity defined in the rate plan. This is determined by the `source` property (either `ALLOWANCE` or `RATE_PLAN_INCLUDED`).

reversal.description: Indicator that determines whether this charge reverses a previous charge.

originalBillReference.description: In the case of a charge reversal, this provides information about the original charge that is reversed.

usageRecords@nextLink.description: A link allows you to retrieve all usage records if more than 100 records are included in this charge.

usageRecords@count.description: The total number of usage records belonging to this charge. Note that it is displayed only when there are more than 100 usage records included in this charge.

usageRecords.description: The usage records belonging to this charge, in case the respective expand option `usageRecords` was used. Note that a maximum of 100 usage records are contained in the collection.

quantity.title: Quantitative Value
quantity.description: Schema defining quantitative value in given measurement unit.

value.description: The value of the item characteristic.

unit.description: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (2-3 characters); if no unit is given, it is assumed to be the code 'C62', which stands for 'pieces' ('1' in math/physics terms, or also 'each').

creditCardSettlementsPostResponse.title: Credit Card Settlements
creditCardSettlementsPostResponse.description: The result of the credit card settlement.

id.description: The unique identifier of the allowance.

documentNumber.description: The document number of the allowance.

allowanceId.description: The unique identifier of the allowance.

allowanceDocumentNumber.description: The document number of the allowance.

id.description: The identifier of the market of the product.

timeZone.description: The time zone of the market.

currency.description: ISO 4217 currency code, for example USD, EUR, CHF

priceType.description: Defines whether the market prices are gross or net.

ratingPeriod.title: Rating Period
ratingPeriod.description: The period for which a charge is calculated and billed. Currently the period is represented as a multiple of calender days. Future functionality in SAP Subscription Billing may also introduce periods that begin and end at a time other than the start of a day in the subscription time zone.

start.description: The start of the rating period, inclusive, given as a UTC-based, ISO 8601 compatible timestamp. Currently it is defined as the start of a day in the time zone of the subscription. Future functionality in SAP Subscription Billing may also lead to a starting point other than the start of the day.

end.description: The end of the rating period, exclusive, given as a UTC-based, ISO 8601 compatible timestamp. Not present for one-time charges. Currently, it is defined as the start of the first day after the rating period in the time zone of the subscription. Future functionality in SAP Subscription Billing may also lead to an period end at a different time of day.

lineNumber.description: The line number of the bill item. A bill item line number is unique per bill. This property is only available for closed bills.

type.description: Indicates whether the charges of this item originate from a subscription (`SUBSCRIPTION`) or from an allowance purchase (`ALLOWANCE`)

customReferences.description: Custom references inherited from product, subscription and subscription item. See documentation for details on inheritance behavior. Not included in the response by default. Use query parameter `expand` with value `customReferences` to include this array in the response.

externalObjectReferences.description: External object references inherited from subscription and subscription item.

markedForDeletion.description: If `true` the corresponding subscription was deleted after the bill was closed. The item can be deleted in a subsequent step by using the `/deletableBillItems` endpoint.

shipTo.description: The party that receives the subscribed product.

transactionId.description: The unique request transaction ID in SAP digital payments add-on.

providerId.description: The ID that can be used to identify the request at the Payment Service Provider.

paymentDateTime.description: The timestamp (UTC) when the transaction was processed in SAP digital payments add-on.

amount.description: The amount that was charged or refunded to the credit card.

monetaryAmount.title: Monetary Amount
monetaryAmount.description: Schema defining monetary amount in given currency.

amount.description: The amount in the specified currency. Given with all three decimal places, rounding half up. The number of decimal places can be more than the default number defined by the international standards for the specified currency.

currency.description: ISO 4217 currency code, for example USD, EUR, CHF

simulation.description: If `true`, the respective bills are not processed but are listed as a preview of bills that potentially would be processed with the given selection criteria.

massClosingRequestDetail.title: Mass Closing Request Detail
massClosingRequestDetail.description: The processing details of a mass closing request.

id.description: The unique identifier of the mass closing request.

createdAt.description: The point in time when the closing request was created.

simulation.description: If `true`, the respective bills are not processed but are listed as a preview of bills that potentially would be processed with the given selection criteria.

processedBills@count.description: The total number of processed bills.

processedBills@nextLink.description: A link to the next page of processed bills if more than 40 processed bills are present.

processedBills.description: A list of the bills that were processed with this request. Contains the first 40 processed bills only. If more than 40 processed bills are present, you can retrieve the bills with the endpoint `/bills/closing/{massClosingRequestId}/processedBills`.

massClosingRequestProcessedBill.title: Processed Bill
massClosingRequestProcessedBill.description: The bill processed by a mass closing request.

billId.description: The bill ID of the processed bill.

successful.description: Indicates whether the triggered closing was successful.

result.title: The closing result of the processed bill.

code.description: Machine-readable code stating the closing result.

message.description: The human-readable description of the code. For program logic in automated follow-up processes, for example integration flows, the machine-readable `code` property must be used instead.

progress.description: The progress of the mass closing request.

billItemDeletionDeletedItem.title: Deleted Bill Item
billItemDeletionDeletedItem.description: A deleted bill item or bill item found for deletion.

id.description: The unique identifier of the event log.

eventType.description: The type of the bill event.

triggeredAt.description: The date and time when the event was triggered.

sendingStatus.description: The status of event processing by SAP Event Mesh.

items.description: A notification tag. Tags are keywords that enable a notification to be easily identified or to trigger follow-up processes.

notificationSetting.description: The notification setting defines a planned notification that is sent when the configured offset is reached.

offsetType.description: Defines whether the offset is before or after the notification-relevant event.

offset.description: The offset to the notification-relevant event in days. For example, the offset to the bill due date: in this case, if the offset type is before and the offset is 2, the notification is sent 2 days before the bill due date.

scheduledFor.description: The date when the event is scheduled to be sent.

massClosingRequestFilter.title: Mass Closing Request Filter
massClosingRequestFilter.description: The filter for the mass closing request.

billIds.description: A list of IDs of the bills that you want to close.

subscriptionId.description: The ID of the subscription for which you want to close bills.

customerNumber.description: The number of the customer for which you want to close bills.

latestClosingAttemptSuccessful.description: Indicates whether you want to close bills for which the latest closing attempt was successful. Set `false` if you want to close bills for which the latest closing attempt failed.

closingMethod.description: The closing method of the bill that you want to close.

start.description: The start of the billing period for which the `billingSettings` are fixed.

end.description: The end of the billing period for which the `billingSettings` are fixed. The end date is exclusive.

billingSettings.title: Billing settings that are applied to the bill and fixed for the billing period.

billingDateDelay.description: Number of days by which the billing date is delayed.

adjustmentCycle.description: The timing of billing for adjustments to charges. Only applies to recurring charges that are billed in advance.

attemptedAt.description: The point in time when the closing attempt happened.

attemptedBy.description: The person who triggered the closing attempt.

successful.description: Indicates whether the closing attempt was successful.

result.title: The result of the closing attempt.

message.description: The human-readable description of the result code. For program logic in automated follow-up processes, for example integration flows, the machine-readable `code` property must be used instead.

id.description: The unique identifier of the failed attempt.

reportedAt.description: The point in time when the failed transfer attempt was reported.

messages.description: Array of strings that contains the messages which were reported along with the failed transfer attempt.

attemptedAt.description: The point in time when the transfer failed. This can be provided by the integration process.

success.description: Indicates whether a successor document was created successfully. Only when this flag is set to `true`, a successor document is assigned to the bill. The value `false` is currently not used and has no effect.

successorDocumentSystem.description: An identifier for the system where the successor document of the bill was created.

successorDocumentId.description: An identifier for the successor document created in the external system. The ID should be unique in the successor document system.

successorDocumentType.description: Caption for the type of document that is created, for example an invoice request.

creditCardSettlements.title: Credit Card Settlements
creditCardSettlements.description: Detail information about the credit card payment settlement. Use query parameter `expand` with value `creditCard` to include this property in the response.

pricingElement.title: Pricing Element
pricingElement.description: An element in pricing that contains attributes such as condition types and condition values. Pricing elements can be prices, surcharges, or discounts.

conditionValue.description: The value resulting from pricing for a pricing element. This can be the total or subtotal in a document.

reportedAt.description: The point in time when the successor document was reported.

id.description: The unique identifier of this usage record item.

itemNumber.description: The number of the usage record item.

obsolete.description: Indicates whether the usage record item is obsolete or not.

documentNumber.description: The document number of the referenced bill. The document number is unique per tenant.

billItemLineNumber.description: The line number of the referenced bill item. A bill item line number is unique per bill. This property is only available for closed bills.

chargeLineNumber.description: The line number of the referenced charge. A charge line number is unique per bill item. This property is only available for closed bills.

id.description: The unique identifier of the mass closing request.

createdAt.description: The point in time when the closing request was created.

simulation.description: If `true`, the respective bills are not processed but are listed as a preview of bills that potentially would be processed with the given selection criteria.

fieldCode.description: The code representing the pricing-relevant field.

dateValue.description: The date value of the pricing-relevant field.

quantityValue.description: The quantity value of the pricing-relevant field.

value.description: The decimal value of the quantity.

stringValue.description: The string value of the pricing-relevant field.

ratioValue.description: The ratio value of the pricing-relevant field.

successorDocumentSystem.description: An identifier for the system to which the transfer failed.

successorDocumentId.description: An identifier for the successor document created in the external system. The ID should be unique in the successor document system.

successorDocumentType.description: Caption for the type of document that failed to create in the successor system.

messages.description: Array of messages that are stored with the failed attempt. The concatenated length of all lines should not exceed 255 characters or the request may be declined.

attemptedAt.description: The point in time when transfer failed.

partner.title: Business Partner
partner.description: A person, organization, group of persons or group of organizations in which a company has a business interest.

id.description: The unique identifier of the business partner.

type.description: The type of the business partner.

country.description: The country/region of the business partner.

method.description:
`MANUAL` if the bill should stay open until closed manually. `AUTO` if the bill should be closed when reaching the billing date.
If set to `AUTO` on or after the regular billing date, the bill is closed immediately.

oauth2.description:
To use this API, you need to obtain the OAuth client credentials (client ID and secret) using the SAP HANA Cloud Platform cockpit. After that, pass these client credentials to the SAP HANA Cloud Platform token endpoint to obtain an access token.
For more information, see the API Guide.

x-sap-shortText: Retrieve bills and manage bill processing and data for follow-on processes.
